text: Marshall Jacob Brickman (August 25, 1939 â€“ November 29, 2024) was a Brazilian- born American screenwriter and director. He was best known for his works with Woody Allen. He shared the Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay in 1978 with Allen for Annie Hall. He was also the head writer for Johnny Carson. Brickman died on November 29, 2024 in New York City at the age of 85. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1939 births Category:2024 deaths Category:Movie directors from New York City Category:Movie producers from New York City Category:Screenwriters from New York City Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Brazilian movie directors Category:Brazilian movie producers Category:Brazilian screenwriters Category:Writers from Rio de Janeiro Category:Academy Award winning writers Category:Musicians from Rio de Janeiro Category:Musicians from New York City
title: Marshall Brickman
